lines.text:
[chasing the ambulance after finding out Kevin has died]
You're supposed to give him a new body! Stop, you idiots! He's supposed to get a biogenetic body!
[Gwen steps out of the ambulance as Maxwell begins to sob]
He was tested, and measured! He told me he'd be the first!

[trying to calm him down]
I know, listen to me! Kevin knew he wasn't going to live very long. He knew it was a matter of time. You see? What happened was, his heart just got too big for his body.
[she hugs him as he continues to cry]
It's okay, honey, it's okay. You go home.
Every word is part of a picture. Every sentence is a picture. All you do, is let your imagination connect them together. If you have an imagination that is.
Why am I always the one who ends up knee deep in crap?
Just think of it as Close Encounters of the Turd Kind.
An Ornithopter is defined as an experimental device, propelled by flapping wings.
That's a big word for a mechanical bird.
[shifting her voice]
Congratulations, Mrs. Dillion. It was a tough delivery, but you've given birth to a healthy 7-pound dictionary.
[smiling]
You must be very proud.
I really don't like rats!
Well, somewhere down there, a rat is saying, I really don't like Max.
Guess what I got for Christmas, Mr. Kane.
Well I don't know...
A squirt gun, and a chemistry set. Good old reliable H2SO4, sulfuric acid. Oily, colorless, and able to strip the paint off a car in 2 seconds. So ask yourself, do I feel lucky today?
you need brains, and I need legs - and the Wizard of Oz doesn't live in South Cincinnati.
Oh, so you're a pacifist.
A what?
A pacifist. "Pass on the fists"? Get it?
[pause]
Right, it's not my best material.
A knight proves his worthiness by his deeds.
[last lines]
By the time we get here, which I guess should be the end, you're going to know the story of Freak the Mighty, who slayed dragons, saved maidens, and walked high above the world.
It was like at that moment, he became my brain, and I became his feet.
It's the treasure, concealed in the slime of dragons.
It's a woman's purse, and it's covered with crap.
From that day, Freak never asked me nothin' about my father, and I never asked him nothin' about his, 'cause that's not who we were.
It sometimes seems like the whole world has just seen me on "America's Most Wanted."
Woman, you are drunk!
Yes, I believe I *am*!

[referring to Kevin's homemade squirt gun]
What did you *really* put in that thing?
Oh, just some soap, and vinegar, and chili pepper.
[first lines]

[narrating]
It was Freak who told me about King Arthur. How he got this round table, and how he got the bravest knights, and the whole world to sit at that table. You will be brothers, said King Arthur. And you will fight for all those who ask for help. You will be gentle to the weak, but terrible to the wicked. It was Freak who told me about King Arthur. It was Freak who told me everything.

[narrating]
He looks like he never smiles - his wife don't look too much happier. That's Gram and Grim. Of course there's a good reason they look like that all the time. They got stuck with me.
Whatcha been doing these past couple of weeks?
Nothin'.
Nothin's a drag, kid. Think about it.
[boards the bus]
Kevin would trade it all for a chance to be normal, to have a friend, and to do what other kids do. Max Kane has given that chance.
[voice cracks]
Well, I'm not going to let that get taken away from my boy.
When someone so great once was, then someone so great will always be.

[tortured]
I look in the mirror and I see his face! I hear my voice and I hear his!
A band of highwaymen ambushed the queen of Saxony in the north road. They stole her chest, no pun intended.

[to Max]
You are nothing like him. You will never be like him. Do you know why? Because you have your mother's heart.
